verbs.description: desocialize (third-person singular simple present desocializes, present participle desocializing, simple past and past participle desocialized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To take out of a social context; individualize.
(transitive) To cause to withdraw from society.
examples: By twelve weeks puppies enter the juvenile stage, and it is at this stage that a negative experience can desocialize the pup.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause to cease to be politically socialist.
examples: It was a painful process to desocialize and rehabilitate the Malian economy.
